h1. Administrator {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator}
With the highest rights, administrators are in charge of the entire management tasks, including [configuring and customizing the Forum portlet|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums_portlet], [backing up data|#Forum_Administrator.Administrative_tasks.Back_up_categories_forums], [managing users and granting permissions|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Manage_Users], [managing categories|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories] and [forums|#Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Manage_forums].
Administrator has the global role.


{docbook}
<para>
<prompt>
    <emphasis role="bold">See also</emphasis>
</prompt>
</para>
{docbook}

* Forum user guide for [Regular users|#Forum_user_guide.Regular_user]
* Forum user guide for [Moderators|#Forum_user_guide.Moderator]

h2. Set up the Forum portlet {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums_portlet}

After adding the application to your *Space*, you have to configure the portlet settings to make it work in your desired way.
{docbook}
<para>
            <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
              <imageobject role="fo">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Setting_gear.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
              <imageobject role="html">
                <imagedata fileref="images/Setting_gear.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="4mm"/>
              </imageobject>
            </inlinemediaobject> <menuchoice><guimenu>Portal</guimenu><guimenuitem>Pages</guimenuitem></menuchoice>.</para>
{docbook}
!images/Forum_portal_page_edit.png|align="center" width="70mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The *Page Manager* page will be displayed.

!images/Page_manager_page.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*2.* Click !images/edit_icon2.png|width="12" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! that corresponds to the *Forum* page in the pages list.

!images/admin_forum_edit_forum_page.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

 <para>
            <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Hover your cursor over the <emphasis role="bold">Forum</emphasis> portlet, then click <inlinemediaobject>

            </inlinemediaobject> in the quick toolbar to open the <guilabel>Edit Mode</guilabel>.</para>
{docbook}
!images/admin_forum_edit_mode.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

This form allows you to configure the *Forum* portlet in various aspects, including:
* [Specify the category scoping|#Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums.Specify_category_scoping]
* [Enable/Disable Forum components|#Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums.Enable-Disable_Forum-components]
* [Enable/Disable a bookmarkable Forum URL|#Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums.Enable-Disable_bookmarkable_Forum_URLs]
h3. Specify the category scoping {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums.Specify_category_scoping}
{docbook}
 <para>In the <guilabel>Scoping</guilabel> tab, you can show/hide categories and forums in the <emphasis role="bold">Forum</emphasis> portlet by selecting or deselecting their respective checkboxes.</para>
{docbook}
h3. Enable/Disable Forum components {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums.Enable-Disable_Forum-components}
{docbook}
<para>In the <guilabel>Panels</guilabel> tab, you can enable/disable some components in the Forum portlet.</para>
{docbook}

Simply select/deselect checkboxes of the components that you want to enable or disable.

!images/admin_forum_panels_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

The following components can be enabled/disabled:

* Show Forum Jump
* Show [Poll|#forum-submitted-poll]
* Moderators
* Show [Quick Reply|#quick_reply_box]
* Show Icons Legend
* Show Rules
* Show Statistics

For example, if you have the *Moderators* or *Show Statistics* panel enabled, you will see it as below:

!images/forum_components.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Forum Statistics*

!images/Forum_statistic_panel.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

h3. Enable/Disable a bookmarkable Forum URL {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Set_up_Forums.Enable-Disable_bookmarkable_Forum_URLs}

Before doing this function, you first need to have a knowledge of Ajax. Ajax (Asynchronous JavaScript and XML) is used in the *Forum* application, aiming at updating a whole webpage or a part of the webpage.

!images/admin_forum_options_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

This feature defines how the links are generated in the *Forum* portlet. You can select to use Ajax or not.

* By not using Ajax, the *Forum* will generate plain URLs in the links. The added benefit will be bookmarkability and better SEO as the links will be permalinks.

* Using Ajax, the links will be Javascript based and generate Ajax calls. This makes your browsing faster because the whole page is not reloaded.

h2. Manage categories {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories}
Only administrators can do categories-related management tasks. To manage forums better, the administrators usually build a good forum structure using categories. So, a category is a set of forums containing all discussions about the same subject. See the following diagram to learn about one typical *Forum* structure.

!images/forum_portlet_structure.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

Managing categories can be performed through the following specific actions:
* [Add a new category|#Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories.Add_categories]
* [Edit a category|#Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories.Edit_categories]
* [Delete a category|#Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories.Delete_categories]

h3. Add a new category {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories.Add_categories}
Only when you are assigned as an *administrator*, you can do this function. Normally, one category is created as public and it allows everyone to access without any restrictions. Meanwhile, one [restricted category|#Manage_categories.Add_categories.Add_restricted_categories] only allows specific users/groups/memberships to access. Also, you can assign moderators to your category and specify a set of permissions for members in the category.

{docbook}
<para>
              <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Add_category_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="17mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Add_category_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="17mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Forum Administration</emphasis> bar. The <guilabel>Category</guilabel> form will be displayed.</para>
{docbook}
!images/admin_category_form.png|align="center" width="300" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Enter the category title into the <guilabel>Title</guilabel> field which is required. Its length must be between 1 and 100 characters (Special characters and spaces are accepted). <anchor id="Step2-add-category"/>
 </para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>In the <guilabel>Category</guilabel> tab, optionally you can also:</para>
{docbook}
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>Enter the order of category in the numeric format into the <guilabel>Order</guilabel> field.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Give a brief description for your category into the <guilabel>Description</guilabel> field.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>Create a category restricted by limiting the number of audiences via one of the following ways: <anchor id="Manage_categories.Add_categories.Add_restricted_categories"/>
                </para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

*The first way*
{docbook}
<para>Enter names of users/groups/memberships that can access this category into the <guilabel>Restricted Audience</guilabel> textbox. The different values are separated by commas.</para>
{docbook}

*The second way* {anchor:id="restricted-audience"}

{docbook}
<para>Use selectors next to the <guilabel>Restricted audience</guilabel> textbox. </para>
{docbook}

*i.* Click !images/Select_user_icon.png|width="3mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to select a specific user from the groups list.

*ii.* Click !images/Select_membership_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to select all users with the specific membership in a group.

*iii.* Click !images/Select_group_icon.png|width="4mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! to select a group of users.

{docbook}
<para>Optionally, select the <guilabel>Permissions</guilabel> tab to specify the category permissions. <anchor id="Manage_categories.Add_categories.Specify_category_permissions"/>
</para>
{docbook}

!images/admin_category_form_permissions_tab.png|align="center" width="300" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

* Do the same ways as setting the "[Restricted audiences|#Manage_categories.Add_categories.Add_restricted_categories]" of a category.
{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish.</para>
{docbook}

h3. Edit a category {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories.Edit_categories}

*1.* Select a category to edit from the *Forum* homepage, then click !images/Manage_category_btn.png|width="22mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar when you are in the categories list.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Edit</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

*3.* Make changes on the category properties.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to save your changes.</para>
{docbook}

h3. Delete a category {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Manage_categories.Delete_categories}

*1.* Select a category to delete from the *Forum* homepage, then click !images/Manage_category_btn.png|width="22mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar.

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Delete</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>OK</guibutton> in the confirmation message to accept your deletion.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<note>
<para>
When a category is removed, all its forums are also removed.
</para>
</note>
{docbook}

h2.  Manage forums {anchor:id=Forum_user_guide.Forum_Administrator.Manage_forums}
Managing forums can be performed through the following actions:

h3. Add a new forum {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Manage_forums.Add_forums}

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para>
    <emphasis role="bold">Add a new forum to a specific category</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>
{docbook}

*1.* Go into the category to which you want to add a new forum.

*2.* Click !images/Add_forum_btn.png|width="15mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on *Forum Administration* bar;

{docbook}
<para>Or, click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Manage_category_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="22mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Manage_category_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="22mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Action</emphasis> bar and select <guilabel>Add Forum</guilabel>.</para>
{docbook}
!images/admin_add_forum.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Enter the forum title which is required. Its length must be less than 50 characters, including spaces.

!images/admin_add_forum_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

Optionally, you can:
* Enter the order for your forum that must be in the positive integer format.
* Select the forum state.
* Select the forum status.
* Give brief description for your forum.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to finish.</para>
{docbook}

The administrators and moderators of a forum may want to get updated of what is new in forums under their management. This can be done when creating a new forum.

{docbook}
<citetitle>
<para xml:id="Forum_Administrator.Manage_forums.Add_forums.Configure_moderation_settings">
    <emphasis role="bold">Configure the moderation settings</emphasis>
</para>
</citetitle>

When creating a forum, you can set moderation-related options.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Select the <guilabel>Moderation Options</guilabel> tab in the <guilabel>Forum</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

*2.* Do actions in the relevant fields.

!images/admin_forum_moderation_options_tab.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*Details:*

{docbook}
<informaltable>
              <tgroup cols="2">
                <thead>
                  <row>
                    <entry>Field</entry>
                    <entry>Description</entry>
                  </row>
                </thead>
                <tbody>
                  <row>
                    <entry> <guilabel>Moderators</guilabel> </entry>
                    <entry> The username of the moderators. </entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Auto-fill the moderator's email</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>Check this option if you want the moderator's email is auto-filled. The email address will be taken from in moderator profile. </entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Email addresses to notify when there is a new post</guilabel>

                  </row>
                  <row>
                    <entry>
                      <guilabel>Email addresses to notify when there is a new topic</guilabel>
                    </entry>
                    <entry>Enter the list of email addresses which will get the notification if any new topic is created.This field will be filled automatically if the <guilabel>Auto-fill the moderator's email</guilabel> is checked .</entry>
                  </row>
                  <row>

                      <guilabel>Moderate Topics</guilabel>

h3. Set up Sort Settings {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Administrative_tasks.Set_up_sort_settings}
{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Forum Administration</emphasis> bar, then click <guilabel>Sort Settings</guilabel> from the drop-down menu. The <guilabel>Sort Settings</guilabel> form opens.  Now, you can set properties for how forums and topics are sorted in <emphasis role="bold">Forum</emphasis>.</para>
{docbook}
Now, you can set properties for how forums and topics are sorted in *Forum*.

!images/admin_forum_sort_setting.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>

              <listitem>

              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Sort Topics by</guilabel>: Sort topics by name, lock status, creation date, modification date, date of last post, post count, view count, attachments count.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Direction</guilabel>: Sort topics in the Ascending or Descending order.</para>
              </listitem>
 </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

h3. Customize an email notification template {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Administrative_tasks.Customize_email_template}

If there are new posts in the category or topic that a user has watched, the user will receive the email notification like this.

!images/admin_forum_email_notification.png|align="center" width="150mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

This section will describe how to create and edit the email templates that can be used to send email notifications to users.

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Forum Administration</emphasis> bar and click <guilabel>Notifications</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Notifications</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/admin_forum_notifications_form.png|align="center" width="120mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>The <guilabel>Notifications</guilabel> form consists of two tabs:</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>New Posts Notification</guilabel>: allow you to customize the template of the email notification when there is a new post/topic in categories/forums/topics that users are watching.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Moved Notification</guilabel>: allow you to customize the template of the email notification when a category/forum/topic/post which is being watched is moved to another location.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

*Details:*
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Notification Subject Template</guilabel>: The template for the notification subject.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Add a prefix to notifications</guilabel>: Tick the checkbox to add a prefix to the email notification.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>Content Notification</guilabel>: The template content of the email notification of new topics/posts that can be modified with the built-in Editor.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

The followings are variables which can be used in the template:

*The common variables for both tabs:*
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>VIEWPOST_LINK</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the public link referring to the new topic/post.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$VIEWPOST_PRIVATE_LINK</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the private link referring to the new topic/post.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$REPLYPOST_LINK</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the private link referring to the topic and a form to reply will be automatically opened.</para>
              </listitem>
            </itemizedlist>
{docbook}

*The variables used in the New Post Notification tab:*
{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$OBJECT_WATCH_TYPE</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the watched object type (category/forum/topic).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$OBJECT_NAME</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the name of the watched object (category/forum/topic).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$ADD_TYPE</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the newly added object type (topic/post).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$ADD_NAME</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the newly added object name (topic name/post name).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$POSTER</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the topic/post owner.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$POST_CONTENT</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the topic/post content.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$TIME</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the time when the topic/post was added.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$DATE</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the date when the topic/post was added.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$CATEGORY</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the category name.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$FORUM</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the forum name.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$TOPIC</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the topic name.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

*The variables used in the Moved Notification tab:*

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$OBJECT_PARENT_NAME</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the forum name (if moving topics) or the topic name (if moving posts).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$OBJECT_PARENT_TYPE</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the type of the moved parent object, such as forum (if moving topics) or topic (if moving posts).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$OBJECT_NAME</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the name of the moved object (topic name/post name).</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>
                  <guilabel>$OBJECT_TYPE</guilabel>: Will be replaced by the type of the moved object (topic/post).</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}


These variables are used to load the content dynamically. Thus, you should not edit them. In case the template is changed unexpectedly, you can go back to the default template by clicking !images/Back_to_default_btn.png|width="5mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!.
You can use the text editor to format the template as you wish.

h3. Ban IPs {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Administrative_tasks.Ban_IPs}
Administrators can ban IP addresses used by users who abuse the forum functions or violate the forum rules and policies. All banned IPs cannot be used to add posts to all forums in the *Forum* application.
Any users who use banned IPs to add post, will be recognized as the banned user. As the result, the banned user can only view in Forum.

{docbook}
<para>Click <inlinemediaobject>
                <imageobject role="fo">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
                <imageobject role="html">
                  <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="20mm"/>
                </imageobject>
              </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Forum Administration</emphasis> bar then click <guilabel>Banned IPs</guilabel> from the drop-down menu. The <guilabel>Banned IPs</guilabel> form appears.</para>
{docbook}

!images/admin_forum_banned_IPs.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!
{anchor:id="administration-ban-IPs"}

{docbook}
<itemizedlist>
              <listitem>
                <para>To ban an IP, simply enter the IP address into the IP textboxes and click <guilabel>[Add]</guilabel>. All banned IPs will be listed in the banned IPs table. You can view all posts which are posted from the specific banned IP or delete them from the banned IPs list.</para>
              </listitem>
              <listitem>
                <para>To view all posts submitted from a specific IPs, click the <guilabel>[Posts]</guilabel> link of the respective IP. These posts can be viewed and deleted by the administrator.</para>
              </listitem>

              <listitem>
                <para>To remove banned IPs from the banned IP list, click the <guilabel>[x]</guilabel> icon of the respective IP.</para>
              </listitem>
</itemizedlist>
{docbook}

Besides, you can also filter the banned IPs if there are so many banned IPs.

To filter banned IPs, enter a part of the IPs address into filter textbox, all IPs matching with filter term will be displayed.

h3. Back up a category & forum {anchor:id=Forum_Administrator.Administrative_tasks.Back_up_categories_forums}
The *Export* function is a best way to back up data in the *Forum* application. This function allows you to export categories and forums in the *Forum* application into the .zip or .xml file. When a category/forum is exported, all of its forum, topics, posts and properties are also exported. This exported file can be used to import into the *Forum* application.

Backing up a category & forum includes the following actions:
* [Export a category|#Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Export_categories]
* [Export a forum|#Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Export_forums]
* [Import a category|#Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Import_categories]
* [Import a forum|#Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Import_forums]

h4. Export a forum {anchor:id=Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Export_forums}
This function is used to export forums and all topics inside the *Forum* application into the .xml or .zip file.

*The first way*

*1.* Go into a forum and click !images/More_actions_btn.png|width="20mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar.

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Export Forum</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Export Forums</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/admin_forum_export_forums.png|align="center" width="80mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Input the file name.

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Tick the <guilabel>Compress</guilabel> checkbox to export the file into the .zip file or leave it blank to export into .xml file.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">5.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to get and store the exported file in your local device.</para>
{docbook}

*The second way*

*1.* Go into a category containing the forum you want to export.

{docbook}
 <para>
                <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                  <imageobject role="fo">
                    <imagedata fileref="images/Manage_category_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="22mm"/>
                  </imageobject>
                  <imageobject role="html">
                    <imagedata fileref="images/Manage_category_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="22mm"/>
                  </imageobject>
                </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Action</emphasis> bar, then click <guilabel>Export Forums</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

!images/admin_forum_export_forum1.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

*3.* Select a forum you want to export by ticking the relevant checkbox.

{docbook}
<para>
                <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Select the <guilabel>Compress</guilabel> checkbox to export the file in the .zip format or leave it blank to export in the .xml format.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
                <emphasis role="bold">5.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to get and store the exported file in your local device.</para>
{docbook}

h4. Import a category {anchor:id=Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Import_categories}

{docbook}
<para>
                <emphasis role="bold">1.</emphasis> Click <inlinemediaobject>
                  <imageobject role="fo">
                    <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="1" width="20mm"/>
                  </imageobject>
                  <imageobject role="html">
                    <imagedata fileref="images/Aministration_btn.png" format="PNG" scalefit="0" width="20mm"/>
                  </imageobject>
                </inlinemediaobject> on the <emphasis role="bold">Forum Administrator</emphasis> bar, then click <guilabel>Import</guilabel> from the drop-down menu to open the <guilabel>Import Category</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

!images/admin_forum_import_cat.png|align="center" width="100mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"!

{docbook}
<para>
<emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Browse...</guibutton> or the <guilabel>Upload Files</guilabel> field to open the <guilabel>File Upload</guilabel> form. Browse and select the file to import.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton>. </para>
{docbook}

h4. Import a forum {anchor:id=Administrative_tasks.Backup_categories_forums.Import_forums}

*1.* Go into one category, then click !images/Manage_category_btn.png|width="22mm" fo:scalefit="1" html:scalefit="0"! on the *Action* bar.

{docbook}
<para>
   <emphasis role="bold">2.</emphasis> Click <guilabel>Import Forum</guilabel> from the drop-down menu.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
  <emphasis role="bold">3.</emphasis> Browse and upload the selected file in the <guilabel>Import Forum</guilabel> form.</para>
{docbook}

{docbook}
<para>
 <emphasis role="bold">4.</emphasis> Click <guibutton>Save</guibutton> to accept importing.</para>
{docbook}
After being imported successfully, the forum and topic data will be displayed properly in the *Forum* homepage.
